Guidelines: 1. Use soft tabs with two spaces—they're the only way to guarantee code renders the same in any environment.
2. When grouping selectors, keep individual selectors to a single line.
3. Include one space before the opening brace of declaration blocks for legibility.
4. Place closing braces of declaration blocks on a new line.
5. Include one space after : for each declaration.
6. Each declaration should appear on its own line for more accurate error reporting.
7. End all declarations with a semi-colon. The last declaration's is optional, but your code is more error prone without it.
8. Comma-separated property values should include a space after each comma (e.g., box-shadow).

9. Don't include spaces after commaswithin rgb(), rgba(), hsl(),hsla(), or rect() values. This helps differentiate multiple color values (comma, no space) from multiple property values (comma with space).
10. Don't prefix property values or color parameters with a leading zero (e.g.,.5 instead of 0.5 and -.5px instead of -0.5px).
11. Lowercase all hex values, e.g., #fff. Lowercase letters are much easier to discern when scanning a document as they tend to have more unique shapes.
12. Use shorthand hex values where available, e.g., #fff instead of#ffffff.
13. Quote attribute values in selectors, e.g.,input[type="text"]. and it’s a good practice for consistency.
14. Avoid specifying units for zero values, e.g., margin: 0; instead of margin: 0px;.
